p: During November 2002, a novel coronavirus caused SARS epidemic in Guangdong, China ( 15), followed by subsequent outbreaks in Hong Kong ( 15, 16). This outbreak was reported to be caused by SARS-CoV, originated from market civets before its transmission and infection in humans ( 17). By the end of the epidemic, SARS-CoV infected 8,098 people and caused 774 fatalities in 29 different countries ( 16). Later on, during June 2012 a patient infected with MERS-CoV developed severe pneumonia and died in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia ( 16, 18), following by series of clustered outbreak in the Middle East and several other countries ( 16, 19). Before transmitting into humans, MERS-CoV originated and replicated in dromedary camels ( 17). Until 2020, MERS-CoV infected 2,468 individuals and caused 851 fatalities worldwide ( 20, 21).
